comment: Value of the limit predicate. ` C ` is the limit of the function ` F ` at ` B ` if the function ` G ` , formed by adding ` B ` to the domain of ` F ` and setting it to ` C ` , is continuous at ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
